intro: Dracopis amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping dracopis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has a creeping growth habit with opposite leaves that often encircle the stems, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
